result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie J Holland Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving the first two (2) years of this sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment; and work hours to the extent allowed not to affect SSI benefits.
Optional, participate in vocational training: department to assist if defendant interested.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain mental health asessment. Successfuly complete follow up treatment. Take any prescription medication  only in the manner as prescribed by physician.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users, dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim Conlin B. and Aaron H.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Participate in anger management, can be as part of mental health programing or separately.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment, and if necessary successfuly complete follow up treatment.  Cooperate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously done so, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (47 pages) commencing 04/15/2015 PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Willie J Holland not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing.  The Court is unable to hear this matter on today due to the lateness of the hour.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie J Holland in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Willie J Holland in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defendant waives his request for a hearing.  New medication is working for the defendant.  Court found the defendant compentant and ordered roceedings reinstated.

Court ordered cash bail of $4000.00 with TOT Justice Point and any other conditions  to remain.  Defense request to reduce cash bail is argued and denied.

Defense request for a plea and sentence date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Willie J Holland not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Competency Hearing.  Due to the lateness of the hour (12pm) the Court is unable to hear this matter on today.  New date selected with the parties and Dr. Robert Rawski.  Competency hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Willie J Holland in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Willie J Holland in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties in receipt of report dated 10-17-14 authored by Dr. Robert Rawski opining the defendant competent.  Defendant challenges said report.  Hearing date selected with the parties and Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Willie J Holland not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Doctor's Report Return.  Branch 21 in jury trial and unable to hear this matter on today.  New date selected with the parties.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Report dated 10-17-15 authored by Dr. Robert Rawski, received and filed.

Defendant Willie J Holland in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Willie J Holland in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties in receipt of report 10-17-14 authored by Dr. Robert Rawski.  Defense has not reviewed the report in its entirety with the defendant.  Case adjourned to allow review of doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie J Holland in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Willie J Holland in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The Court proceeds with plea colloquy with the defendant.  The Court halts plea hearing  prior to guilty plea based upon the answers of the defendant in regards to medication issues.  On it's own motion, the court orders the defendant to be evaluated for competency.  The court suspended the proceedings and ordered the defendant be examined by the Department of Health Services.  Defense waives time limits as to scheduling of hearing.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Willie J Holland not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense awaiting medical records.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Matter before the Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Bailey to notify the public defender's office of the need for appointment.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie J Holland in court with attorney Chris Bailey.  Defendant Willie J Holland in custody.  Margaret Kunisch for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gilbert Carrasco-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Colin B.; Aaroin H.; Xavier A.; Andrew A. or Terrell W
